A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: An interesting film that seems to draw inspiration from old war stories in the real world. Very unlike the tone of previous films\, but I get that they're trying to portray the darkness before the dawn. And the truth is\, this is usually how the revolutions played out in history. You start with a small army\, gain some traction\, win a couple battles but also lose a lot more. Then one day\, you start a big enough fire to achieve your goals. It's a slow process\, and I don't blame the fans for finding it boring. Disney seems intent on making the days of darkness seem realistic. But I do find it amazing that after fighting for so many years\, the rebels still haven't garnered enough support for anything beyond guerrilla warfare.
